reasons_to_visit.details: Experience Geneva as winter loosens its grip. Enjoy major museums (Art & History, Red Cross, Ethnography) and indoor attractions with significantly fewer crowds than peak seasons.
Benefit from generally lower prices for flights and accommodation compared to summer, although check for spikes if Easter falls in late March or during major events like FIFDH.
Witness early spring flowers like crocuses and daffodils along the lake promenades and parks. Late March might see the first magnolias blooming (e.g., Parc des Bastions).

reasons_to_visit.reason: Ideal for Indoor Culture & International Flair
reasons_to_visit.details: Unpredictable weather makes March perfect for exploring Geneva's world-class museums, watch boutiques, the UN Palais des Nations (tours), and enjoying cozy cafes in Carouge or the Old Town.
Still a viable time for day trips to nearby French Alpine resorts (Chamonix, Megève) for late-season skiing/snowboarding, often enjoying spring snow conditions.
Attend screenings and debates at the prestigious International Film Festival and Forum on Human Rights (FIFDH), typically held in March, attracting international attention.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: March is notorious for volatile weather: sun, rain, wind ('bise'), grey skies, even late snow/sleet can occur within hours. Temperatures fluctuate widely.
Average highs hover around 11-13°C (52-55°F), nights often near freezing. The 'bise' wind can make it feel much colder, especially near the lake. Waterproof layers are key.
Days lengthen significantly (approx. 11-13 hours daylight), but are still considerably shorter than peak summer, limiting evening outdoor time.
Ski conditions vary. Lower trails like on Mont Salève might be muddy or have snow patches. Higher routes are generally inaccessible without snow gear.
If Easter falls late March, Good Friday/Easter Monday are public holidays. Expect widespread shop closures and reduced services.
It's often too cold, wet, or windy to comfortably enjoy extended periods outdoors (picnics, lakeside lounging) without proper gear.

weather.precipitation: Highly variable: mix of sun, cloud, rain showers, possibly sleet. Can be quite windy, especially if the 'bise' blows.
weather.general_tips: Pack versatile layers: thermal base, fleece/sweater, waterproof/windproof outer jacket, hat, gloves, scarf, waterproof boots. Umbrella essential.

tourism_level.crowds: Low season persists initially, but FIFDH attracts international visitors and local attendees.
tourism_level.pricing: Generally good value, but check prices around FIFDH dates.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Late winter feel slowly giving way. City is relatively quiet apart from festival buzz. Focus on indoor culture or mountain day trips.

events_holidays.name: International Film Festival and Forum on Human Rights (FIFDH)
events_holidays.description: Major international event featuring documentary and fiction films focused on human rights issues, accompanied by debates, conferences, and masterclasses.
events_holidays.notes: Check the official FIFDH program for venues, screenings, and tickets. Very popular.

unique_experiences.activity: Attend a FIFDH Screening or Debate
unique_experiences.where: Various cinemas and venues across Geneva
unique_experiences.description: Engage with important global issues through powerful films and discussions at this renowned festival.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book tickets online in advance for specific screenings or popular debates. Check venue locations.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit the International Red Cross Museum (MICR)
unique_experiences.description: Explore the history and impact of humanitarian action through compelling exhibits. An appropriate visit during FIFDH.
Wander the unique Italianate streets, browse artisan boutiques, and find a cozy cafe to escape the unpredictable March weather.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Many shops closed Mondays. Offers a different, bohemian vibe.

unique_experiences.where: Resorts like Chamonix, Megève, La Clusaz
unique_experiences.description: Catch the end of the ski season with a day trip to the nearby French Alps. Check conditions for spring skiing.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book bus transfers. Bring passport. Rent gear locally or at resort. Check snow/weather reports.

weather.precipitation: Still very changeable ('giboulées'), but increasing chance of milder, brighter days. Rain showers common. Snow in city very unlikely.
weather.general_tips: Continue layering, waterproofs still crucial. Enjoy the noticeably longer daylight hours. Clocks may change forward for summer time late March.

tourism_level.crowds: Remains relatively low shoulder season, unless Easter falls late, which increases visitors and local activity.
tourism_level.pricing: Generally good value, but check for Easter holiday price increases if applicable.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: More distinct signs of spring emerge. Early flowers visible. City feels brighter with longer days. Easter preparations may be visible if applicable.

events_holidays.name: International Film Festival and Forum on Human Rights (FIFDH) (Conclusion)
events_holidays.date: Usually ends mid/late March (check exact dates)
events_holidays.description: Final days of screenings, awards ceremony, and related events.

events_holidays.name: Easter Weekend (Potential - Check Dates)
events_holidays.description: If Easter occurs: Good Friday & Easter Monday are public holidays. Look for Easter decorations, chocolate shops are busy. Special church services.
events_holidays.notes: Widespread shop closures Good Friday/Easter Monday. Check attraction opening times.

events_holidays.name: First Magnolia Blooms Potential
events_holidays.description: Keep an eye out for the beautiful magnolia trees starting to bloom, especially in Parc des Bastions or near the University.
events_holidays.notes: Highly dependent on the year's weather patterns.

unique_experiences.description: Immerse yourself in the art of high watchmaking and enamelling. Perfect indoor activity for a cool or wet day.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow 1.5-2 hours. Check opening hours (often closed Sun/Mon). Audio guide recommended.

unique_experiences.where: Quai du Mont-Blanc, Quai Gustave-Ador, Jardin Anglais
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a bracing walk by the lake as it awakens for spring. See early flowers, watch the Jet d'Eau (check operational times), enjoy views on clear days.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Dress warmly, the 'bise' wind can be strong. Flat and easy walking.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit the Conservatory and Botanical Garden (CJB)
unique_experiences.description: Explore the greenhouses for tropical and Mediterranean plants, and see the first outdoor spring blooms emerging in the extensive grounds.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Free entry. Greenhouses offer warmth on cold days. Check opening times.

unique_experiences.activity: Take a Limited Lake Cruise (Potential Start)
unique_experiences.description: Check if CGN (lake boat company) has started its limited spring schedule for short cruises around the 'Petit Lac' (Geneva basin).
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Schedules are very limited compared to summer. Check the CGN website directly. Dress warmly.
